section.title: Introduction
section.simpara: This document is an introduction to AsciiDoc and some of the basic formatting options.
The source document - noddy.adoc - is best viewed in a plain text editor or in "Raw" mode in GitHub so as to display the AsciiDoc markup.

note.simpara: Headings can be automatically numbered with by adding the :sectnums: attribute to the document header. However, autonumbering of headings don’t appear to carry through to docbook output and downstream files, e.g. chunked xhtml. Automatic links and anchors can be enabled with the :sectlinks: and :sectanchors: attributes.

section.title: Paragraphs and line breaks
section.simpara: Paragraphs don’t require any special markup in AsciiDoc. A paragraph is just one or more lines of consecutive text.
To begin a new paragraph, separate it by at least one blank line. Newlines within a paragraph are not displayed.
Manual line breaks can be forced with a "plus" sign at the end of a line.
Or use [%hardbreaks] at the start of a paragraph in order to force line breaks.
The following paragraph will return to normal line breaks.

note.simpara: Line breaks don’t appear to carry through to docbook output and downstream files, e.g. chunked xhtml.

note.simpara: Horizontal rules don’t appear to carry through to docbook output and downstream files, e.g. chunked xhtml.

section.title: Bold, italics and monospace
section.simpara: You can make words or whole lines bold by enclosing with an asterisk.
Use underscores for italics.
And monospace text can be forced with backticks.
The above can be combined.

section.title: Code blocks
section.simpara: Prefixing lines/blocks with a single space will result in literal sections:
This is useful for defining code/output blocks:
section.literallayout: $ ls -ld .bash* -rw-------. 1 toda1 toda1 23576 Apr 19 16:29 .bash_history -rw-r--r--. 1 toda1 toda1 18 Aug 2 2016 .bash_logout -rw-r--r--. 1 toda1 toda1 745 Apr 17 10:29 .bash_profile -rw-r--r--. 1 toda1 toda1 814 Apr 19 09:21 .bashrc $
section.simpara: Or you can specify a code block with four repeated hyphens enclosing the block.
section.screen: if [ "$playlist" = "Wittertainment" ] then echo "Hello to Jason Isaacs" fi

tip.simpara: Code blocks can have additional formatting such as titles, callouts and language specific syntax highlighting. See https://asciidoctor.org/docs/asciidoc-syntax-quick-reference/#source-code for examples.

section.simpara: Alternatively, enclose the block with four repeated periods for a literal block.

section.title: Escaping special characters
section.simpara: There are several ways to escape text / special characters, ref: https://asciidoctor.org/docs/asciidoc-syntax-quick-reference/#escaping-text
Here are some simple examples - view the raw adoc file to see how each is implemented:

listitem.simpara: Use a backslash to escape, e.g. \*don't bold me* → *don’t bold me*
define this in the header section: :my_substitution: pass:normal[{asterisk}don't bold me{asterisk}]
raw passthrough: +++*don't bold me*+++ → *don't bold me*
passthrough macro: pass:[*don't bold me*] → *don't bold me*

appendix.title: Notes on creating appendices
appendix.simpara: Appendix headings can be created automagically by adding [appendix] on the line preceding a heading.
